intro: Denhamia peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular denhamia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of the Malay Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to habitat loss, Denhamia peninsularis is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
